sentence.text: Detrimental antidepressant drug-drug interactions: are they clinically relevant?
This paper takes the position that detrimental drug-drug interactions (DDIs) involving antidepressants are clinically relevant
In doing so, it begins with a definition of the terms: drug-drug interaction, detrimental, and clinical relevance
It then discusses the issues of proof and provides an overview of the clinically relevant DDIs involving antidepressants
It also gives examples involving drugs besides antidepressants based on the premise that the underlying principles are applicable regardless of the therapeutic classes of the drugs involved
